Class CivController

  • java.lang.Object
    • CivController
  • public class CivController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as the controller for the MVC (Mode/Control/View) architecture and contains method which perform different tasks that facilitates the logic and functionality of the game. This class can check if their player'computer moves are valid, it handles the actions like moving, attacking, and spawning; it can also update the stats of the the player, the computer and both of their units.
    Author:
    Anh Nguyen Phung, Hung Le Ba, Thu Tra, Peter Vo

    • Method Detail

      • setSpawned

        public void setSpawned()
        Set the isSpwaned field to true and inform the program that spawning is possible

      • endTurn

        public void endTurn​(java.lang.String player)
        Ends the turn and reset all the field for the next player's turn
        Parameters:
        player - type of player "Human" or "Computer"

      • isAbleToSpawn

        private boolean isAbleToSpawn​(java.lang.String character,
                              java.lang.String playerType)
        Check if a player can spawn the given character
        Parameters:
        character - the character type to be spawned
        playerType - type of player "Human" or "Computer"
        Returns:
        true if the player can spawn the character, and false if the character is invalid, the player exceeds max unit count, or is out of gold to buy the given character

      • isValidSpawnPosition

        private boolean isValidSpawnPosition​(int row,
                                     int col,
                                     java.lang.String playerType)
        Check a position can be spawned by a given player. Computer spawns the first two rows, and Human spawns the last two rows
        Parameters:
        row - the row position to be spawned
        col - the column position to be spawned
        playerType - type of player "Human" or "Computer"
        Returns:
        true if the position can be spawned by the given player, and false otherwise

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Check if the game is over (one side has no unit left)
        Returns:
        true if the game is over and false otherwise

      • isGameBegin

        public boolean isGameBegin()
        Check if the game has started already (one side has completed their turn)
        Returns:
        true if the game is started and false otherwise

      • determineWinner

        public java.lang.String determineWinner()
        Check for the one with more unit count
        Returns:
        "Human" if human side has more unit count, and "Computer" if computer side has more unit count. If tied then return null.

      • computerMove

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> computerMove()
        Represents a move from the computer
        Returns:
        a set of positions (represented as index of the 2D board array) that has been attacked in this turn

      • optimizeAttack

        private int optimizeAttack​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> attack)
        Choose the optimal unit to attack. In this implementation, it is the unit in range that has the lowest health score
        Parameters:
        attack - available attack positions
        Returns:
        position of the unit in range that has the lowest health

      • allPossibleMoves

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> allPossibleMoves​(int row,
                                                                                                int col,
                                                                                                java.lang.String player)
        All possible moves (attack or move unit) from the position (row, col) If the position is empty or the given player does not occupy that position, then return null
        Parameters:
        row - the position to make a move from
        col - the column position to make a move from
        player - current player to make a move
        Returns:
        a map containing appropriate positions as values for two keys: "Move" and "Attack"

      • displayStats

        public CivCharacter displayStats​(int row,
                                 int col)
        Display stats of a cell at (row, col)
        Parameters:
        row - the row position to get stats from
        col - the column position to get stats from
        Returns:
        the CivCharacter that is in the cell

      • handleClick

        public boolean handleClick​(int row,
                           int col,
                           java.lang.String character)
        Handle interactions to a cell when it is clicked. Can be spawning a new character, moving the current character out of the cell, moving a pre-selected character into the cell, making the current character in the cell attack another unit, or attacking the current unit in the cell
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the clicked cell
        col - the column of the clicked cell
        character - the character that is given when clicked, in case of spawning
        Returns:
        true if the cell is attacked and false otherwise

      • handleAttack

        private void handleAttack​(int prevRow,
                          int prevCol,
                          int row,
                          int col,
                          CivPlayer player,
                          CivCharacter civChar)
        Handle interactions to a cell when it is attacked
        Parameters:
        prevRow - row of the cell clicked prior to the current cell
        prevCol - column of the cell clicked prior to the current cell
        row - the row of the clicked cell
        col - the column of the clicked cell
        player - the player of the previously clicked cell (the attacker)
        civChar - the character of the previously clicked cell (the attacker)

      • handleMove

        private void handleMove​(int prevRow,
                        int prevCol,
                        int row,
                        int col,
                        CivPlayer player,
                        CivCharacter civChar)
        Handle interactions to a cell when a unit is being moved to it
        Parameters:
        prevRow - row of the cell clicked prior to the current cell
        prevCol - column of the cell clicked prior to the current cell
        row - the row of the clicked cell
        col - the column of the clicked cell
        player - the player of the previously clicked cell
        civChar - the character of the previously clicked cell

      • handleAddUnit

        private void handleAddUnit​(java.lang.String character,
                           CivPlayer player,
                           int row,
                           int col)
        Add unit to an empty cell and the player's team when they spawned
        Parameters:
        player - the current player (human or computer)
        character - the character that has been spawned
        row - the row of the cell to spawn on
        col - the column of cell to spawn on
